message.content: Use frontend-design Skill to create analyse app structure and generate design_brief.mdBuild the Dashboard.tsx following design_brief.md exactly. Use existing types and services from src/types/ and src/services/. Deploy when done using the deploy_to_github tool.

content.text: I'll start by reading the app metadata and skill files to understand the data and design guidelines.

content.content:
1→---
     2→name: frontend-impl
     3→description: |
     4→  Activate this skill when:
     5→  - Implementing Dashboard.tsx
     6→  - Following design_brief.md
     7→  - Writing React/TypeScript code
     8→  - Integrating with Living Apps API
     9→allowed-tools:
    10→  - Read
    11→  - Write
    12→  - Edit
    13→  - Bash
    14→  - Glob
    15→  - Grep
    16→---
    17→
    18→# Frontend Implementation Skill
    19→
    20→You are a React/TypeScript developer. Your ONLY job is to **implement exactly what design_brief.md describes**.
    21→
    22→## ⚠️ CRITICAL: Build a COMPLETE, PRODUCTION-READY Dashboard
    23→
    24→**This is not a prototype. This is not a demo. This is a production dashboard.**
    25→
    26→You MUST:
    27→- **Implement EVERY feature** described in design_brief.md - do not skip anything
    28→- **Show ALL information** users need - no placeholder "coming soon" sections
    29→- **Primary action must work** - users can add/create from the dashboard
    30→- **Handle all states** - loading, empty, error states for every component
    31→- **Be ready for real users** - this goes live immediately after you build it
    32→
    33→**DO NOT:**
    34→- ❌ Skip features because they seem complex
    35→- ❌ Leave any section incomplete with "TODO" comments
    36→- ❌ Implement only the "happy path"
    37→- ❌ Create a read-only view when actions are needed
    38→
    39→---
    40→
    41→## ⚠️ CRITICAL: You Do NOT Make Design Decisions
    42→
    43→All design decisions are ALREADY MADE in `design_brief.md`. The designer wrote detailed instructions - follow them word for word.
    44→
    45→**Your job:**
    46→1. Read design_brief.md COMPLETELY
    47→2. Implement EXACTLY what it describes
    48→3. Do not deviate or "improve"
    49→
    50→**FORBIDDEN Actions:**
    51→- ❌ Choosing a different font than the brief specifies
    52→- ❌ Changing colors from the brief
    53→- ❌ Rearranging the layout differently than described
    54→- ❌ Adding components not mentioned in the brief
    55→- ❌ Using "sensible defaults" instead of what the brief says
    56→- ❌ Using Inter, Roboto, or system fonts (unless brief says so)
    57→- ❌ Interpreting the brief "creatively" - implement literally
    58→
    59→**The design_brief.md is written instructions from a designer. Follow them exactly.**
    60→
    61→---
    62→
    63→## Process
    64→
    65→### Step 1: Read the Design Brief COMPLETELY
    66→
    67→```bash
    68→cat design_brief.md
    69→```
    70→
    71→Read the ENTIRE brief carefully. Pay attention to:
    72→
    73→- **Section 3: Theme & Colors** → Font name, URL, and all color values
    74→- **Section 4: Mobile Layout** → Exact structure for phone screens
    75→- **Section 5: Desktop Layout** → Exact structure for computer screens
    76→- **Section 6: Components** → Hero KPI, secondary KPIs, charts, lists, CRUD per app
    77→- **Section 7: Navigation** → React Router routes, sidebar, bottom tabs
    78→- **Section 8: Visual Details** → Border radius, shadows, animations
    79→- **Section 9: CSS Variables** → Copy these EXACTLY into src/index.css
    80→
    81→The brief explains WHY decisions were made. This helps you understand intent, but your job is to implement what is written, not to interpret.
    82→
    83→### Step 2: Read Existing Code
    84→
    85→```bash
    86→cat src/types/*.ts
    87→cat src/services/livingAppsService.ts
    88→```
    89→
    90→### Step 3: Apply CSS Variables FIRST (CRITICAL!)
    91→
    92→Before writing any React code, update the theme. Copy the CSS from **Section 8** of design_brief.md into `src/index.css`.
    93→
    94→shadcn/ui components use Tailwind CSS variables. If you don't update them, `<Card>`, `<Button>`, etc. will use **default colors** that don't match the design!
    95→
    96→```
    97→design_brief.md → src/index.css → Tailwind classes → shadcn components
    98→   (Section 8)      (CSS variables)   (bg-card, etc.)   (Card, Button)
    99→```
   100→
   101→#### Step 3a: Copy CSS Variables
   102→
   103→The design_brief.md Section 8 contains ready-to-copy CSS. Copy it EXACTLY:
   104→
   105→```css
   106→:root {
   107→  /* Copy ALL values from design_brief.md Section 8 */
   108→  --background: hsl(...);
   109→  --foreground: hsl(...);
   110→  /* etc. */
   111→}
   112→```
   113→
   114→#### Step 3b: Light Mode (Always)
   115→
   116→The design brief uses light mode. Make sure `index.html` does NOT have `class="dark"`:
   117→
   118→```html
   119→<html lang="de">  <!-- No "dark" class for light theme -->
   120→```
   121→
   122→### Step 4: Add Font
   123→
   124→Copy the font URL from **Section 3** of design_brief.md into `index.html`:
   125→
   126→```html
   127→<link href="[URL from Section 3]" rel="stylesheet">
   128→```
   129→
   130→### Step 5: Set Up React Router
   131→
   132→**Before implementing any pages**, set up React Router:
   133→
   134→1. Install `react-router-dom` if not already installed
   135→2. Set up `BrowserRouter` with `basename` in `main.tsx`
   136→3. Create `Layout.tsx` with sidebar (desktop) + bottom tabs (mobile)
   137→4. Define routes in `App.tsx` — one route per app from design_brief.md Section 7
   138→5. Create page files in `src/pages/`
   139→
   140→See the **React Router Navigation** section below for complete code patterns.
   141→
   142→### Step 6: Implement Pages
   143→
   144→Create one page per app + the Dashboard Overview:
   145→
   146→```typescript
   147→// 1. Imports (always use 'import type' for types!)
   148→import { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
   149→import type { AppType1, AppType2 } from '@/types/app';
   150→import { LivingAppsService } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
   151→
   152→// 2. Follow Section 4 (Mobile) and Section 5 (Desktop) for layout
   153→// 3. Follow Section 6 for components (Hero, KPIs, Charts, Lists, CRUD)
   154→// 4. Follow Section 7 for navigation routes
   155→// 5. Follow Section 8 for visual details (radius, shadows, animations)
   156→```
   157→
   158→### Step 7: Build and Deploy
   159→
   160→```bash
   161→npm run build
   162→```
   163→
   164→Then call `mcp__deploy_tools__deploy_to_github`
   165→
   166→```css
   167→:root {
   168→  /* Light mode defaults - used when NO .dark class */
   169→}
   170→
   171→.dark {
   172→  /* Dark mode - used when <html class="dark"> */
   173→}
   174→```
   175→
   176→**Color Mapping Table:**
   177→
   178→| design_brief.md section | CSS Variable | Used by |
   179→|----------------------|--------------|---------|
   180→| `theme.colors.background` | `--background` | `bg-background`, body |
   181→| `theme.colors.foreground` | `--foreground` | `text-foreground`, body text |
   182→| `theme.colors.card` | `--card` | `<Card>` background |
   183→| `theme.colors.foreground` | `--card-foreground` | Text inside cards |
   184→| `theme.colors.primary` | `--primary` | `<Button>` default |
   185→| `theme.colors.accent` | `--accent` | Accent elements |
   186→| `theme.colors.muted` | `--muted` | Muted backgrounds |
   187→| `theme.colors.border` | `--border` | All borders |
   188→| `theme.colors.positive` | `--chart-2` | Success/positive in charts |
   189→| `theme.colors.negative` | `--destructive` | Error/negative |
   190→
   191→#### Step 4c: Example - Applying a Dark Theme
   192→
   193→If design_brief.md says:
   194→```json
   195→{
   196→  "theme": {
   197→    "mode": "dark",
   198→    "colors": {
   199→      "background": "hsl(215 28% 7%)",
   200→      "foreground": "hsl(215 10% 92%)",
   201→      "card": "hsl(215 25% 12%)",
   202→      "primary": "hsl(25 95% 53%)",
   203→      "accent": "hsl(173 80% 45%)",
   204→      "muted": "hsl(215 15% 20%)",
   205→      "border": "hsl(215 20% 18%)"
   206→    }
   207→  }
   208→}
   209→```
   210→
   211→Then update `src/index.css`:
   212→
   213→```css
   214→.dark {
   215→  --background: hsl(215 28% 7%);
   216→  --foreground: hsl(215 10% 92%);
   217→  
   218→  --card: hsl(215 25% 12%);
   219→  --card-foreground: hsl(215 10% 92%);
   220→  
   221→  --popover: hsl(215 25% 12%);
   222→  --popover-foreground: hsl(215 10% 92%);
   223→  
   224→  --primary: hsl(25 95% 53%);
   225→  --primary-foreground: hsl(215 28% 7%);
   226→  
   227→  --accent: hsl(173 80% 45%);
   228→  --accent-foreground: hsl(215 28% 7%);
   229→  
   230→  --muted: hsl(215 15% 20%);
   231→  --muted-foreground: hsl(215 10% 70%);
   232→  
   233→  --border: hsl(215 20% 18%);
   234→  --input: hsl(215 20% 18%);
   235→  --ring: hsl(173 80% 45%);
   236→}
   237→```
   238→
   239→And update `index.html`:
   240→```html
   241→<html lang="de" class="dark">
   242→```
   243→
   244→#### ⚠️ CRITICAL: CSS Color Format
   245→
   246→The CSS variables **MUST use complete color functions**, not raw values!
   247→
   248→**❌ WRONG - Raw values break Tailwind:**
   249→```css
   250→.dark {
   251→  --background: 220 25% 6%;        /* ❌ Just numbers - NOT a valid CSS color! */
   252→  --card: 220 20% 10%;             /* ❌ Browser ignores this, uses fallback! */
   253→}
   254→```
   255→
   256→**✅ CORRECT - Complete color functions:**
   257→```css
   258→.dark {
   259→  --background: hsl(220 25% 6%);   /* ✓ Complete hsl() function */
   260→  --card: hsl(220 20% 10%);        /* ✓ Tailwind can use this */
   261→}
   262→```
   263→
   264→**Why raw values fail:**
   265→- Tailwind reads `var(--background)` directly for `bg-background`
   266→- If `--background` is `220 25% 6%` (just numbers), it's NOT a valid CSS color
   267→- Browser ignores invalid colors → falls back to white/transparent
   268→- Result: Light backgrounds with dark text = invisible!
   269→
   270→**Always copy the FULL hsl() function from design_brief.md Section 8, including the function name!**
   271→
   272→#### Why This Matters
   273→
   274→Without this step:
   275→- `<Card>` uses default background (light/white)
   276→- Text colors (from design_brief) are for dark backgrounds
   277→- Result: **Light text on light cards = invisible!**
   278→
   279→With this step:
   280→- All shadcn components automatically use your theme colors
   281→- Consistent look across all UI elements
   282→- No need to add inline styles everywhere
   283→
   284→### Step 5: Add Font from Spec
   285→
   286→In `index.html`, add the font URL from design_brief.md Section 3:
   287→```html
   288→<link href="{font_url from spec}" rel="stylesheet">
   289→```
   290→
   291→### Step 6: Build and Test
   292→
   293→```bash
   294→npm run build  # Must compile without errors
   295→```
   296→
   297→### Step 7: Deploy
   298→
   299→```
   300→Call mcp__deploy_tools__deploy_to_github
   301→```
   302→
   303→---
   304→
   305→## Critical Implementation Rules
   306→
   307→### 1. Type Imports
   308→```typescript
   309→// ❌ WRONG
   310→import { Workout } from '@/types/app';
   311→
   312→// ✅ CORRECT
   313→import type { Workout } from '@/types/app';
   314→```
   315→
   316→### 2. extractRecordId Always Has Null Check
   317→```typescript
   318→const id = extractRecordId(record.fields.relation);
   319→if (!id) return;  // ✅ Always check!
   320→```
   321→
   322→### 3. Dates Without Seconds
   323→```typescript
   324→// For API: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM (no seconds!)
   325→const dateForAPI = formData.date + 'T12:00';
   326→```
   327→
   328→### 4. Select Never Has Empty Value
   329→```typescript
   330→// ❌ WRONG
   331→<SelectItem value="">None</SelectItem>
   332→
   333→// ✅ CORRECT
   334→<SelectItem value="none">None</SelectItem>
   335→```
   336→
   337→---
   338→
   339→## Implementation Checklist
   340→
   341→Before completing, verify EACH item against design_brief.md:
   342→
   343→### Theme Verification (CRITICAL!)
   344→- [ ] Font in `index.html` is EXACTLY from design_brief.md Section 3 (NOT Inter or Roboto!)
   345→- [ ] Font-family in CSS matches EXACTLY design_brief.md Section 3
   346→- [ ] `index.html` has NO "dark" class (light theme)
   347→- [ ] ALL CSS variables in `src/index.css` copied EXACTLY from design_brief.md Section 8
   348→- [ ] Colors are complete hsl() functions (not raw values)
   349→
   350→### Navigation Verification
   351→- [ ] React Router set up with `BrowserRouter` and `basename`
   352→- [ ] Routes defined for every app (one page per app)
   353→- [ ] Dashboard Overview page at `/` with summary KPIs
   354→- [ ] Desktop sidebar navigation with active state styling
   355→- [ ] Mobile bottom tab navigation with active state styling
   356→- [ ] Navigation matches EXACTLY design_brief.md Section 7
   357→- [ ] Mobile bottom tabs don't overlap page content
   358→
   359→### Layout Verification
   360→- [ ] Mobile layout matches EXACTLY design_brief.md Section 4
   361→- [ ] Desktop layout matches EXACTLY design_brief.md Section 5
   362→- [ ] Hero element stands out as described
   363→- [ ] Section order matches the brief
   364→
   365→### Components Verification
   366→- [ ] Hero KPI matches EXACTLY design_brief.md Section 6 "Hero KPI"
   367→- [ ] Secondary KPIs match EXACTLY design_brief.md Section 6
   368→- [ ] Chart matches EXACTLY design_brief.md Section 6 "Chart"
   369→- [ ] Primary action matches EXACTLY design_brief.md Section 6
   370→
   371→### Visual Details Verification
   372→- [ ] Border radius matches design_brief.md Section 7
   373→- [ ] Shadow style matches design_brief.md Section 7
   374→- [ ] Animations match design_brief.md Section 7
   375→
   376→### Technical
   377→- [ ] `npm run build` passes
   378→- [ ] No console errors
   379→
   380→### ⚠️ COMPLETENESS VERIFICATION (CRITICAL!)
   381→
   382→**You MUST verify the dashboard is 100% complete before finishing:**
   383→
   384→- [ ] **Every app in app_metadata.json is used** - no data sources ignored
   385→- [ ] **Every app has FULL CRUD** - Create, Read, Update, Delete for EACH app
   386→- [ ] **Primary action works** (create new record via dialog/form)
   387→- [ ] **Edit works** for every app (pre-filled form, PATCH request)
   388→- [ ] **Delete works** for every app (confirmation dialog, DELETE request)
   389→- [ ] **Data displays correctly** (all KPIs calculated, lists populated)
   390→- [ ] **All states handled:**
   391→  - [ ] Loading states for every data fetch
   392→  - [ ] Empty states with helpful guidance
   393→  - [ ] Error states with retry options
   394→- [ ] **Nothing is placeholder:**
   395→  - [ ] No "TODO" comments in code
   396→  - [ ] No "Coming soon" messages
   397→  - [ ] No hardcoded demo data
   398→- [ ] **CRUD feedback** - Toast messages for success/error on every operation
   399→- [ ] **Data refresh** - Lists update after create/update/delete
   400→
   401→**If ANY item above is unchecked, the dashboard is NOT complete. Fix it before deploying.**
   402→
   403→---
   404→
   405→## Definition of Done
   406→
   407→The dashboard is complete when:
   408→
   409→1. ✅ **User experience excellent**: Intuitive, clear, professional
   410→2. ✅ **React Router navigation** works (sidebar on desktop, bottom tabs on mobile)
   411→3. ✅ **Every app has its own page/route** with full CRUD
   412→4. ✅ **Dashboard Overview page** shows summary KPIs across all apps
   413→5. ✅ **Full CRUD for EVERY app** - Create, Read, Update, Delete all work
   414→6. ✅ **Primary action button works** (with Dialog/Modal)
   415→7. ✅ **Edit records works** for every app (pre-filled form, saves changes)
   416→8. ✅ **Delete records works** for every app (with confirmation dialog)
   417→9. ✅ All KPIs/Stats calculated correctly
   418→10. ✅ Loading state works (Skeleton, not empty page)
   419→11. ✅ Error handling implemented (friendly messages)
   420→12. ✅ Empty state implemented (helpful placeholders)
   421→13. ✅ Responsive design (Mobile + Desktop)
   422→14. ✅ No TypeScript errors (`npm run build`)
   423→15. ✅ No console errors in browser
   424→16. ✅ Business logic correct
   425→17. ✅ Living Apps API rules followed (dates, applookup, response)
   426→18. ✅ **All features complete** - nothing skipped or left as TODO
   427→19. ✅ **CRUD feedback** - Toast messages on success/error for every operation
   428→
   429→---
   430→
   431→## Full CRUD Implementation (REQUIRED for Every App!)
   432→
   433→**⚠️ CRITICAL: Every app in the dashboard MUST have full CRUD operations.**
   434→
   435→The design_brief.md specifies CRUD operations for each app. You MUST implement ALL of them - Create, Read, Update, Delete - for EVERY app. No exceptions.
   436→
   437→### CRUD Architecture Pattern
   438→
   439→For each app, implement these components:
   440→
   441→1. **List/Table View** - Shows all records (Read)
   442→2. **Create/Edit Dialog** - Shared dialog for creating and editing (Create + Update)
   443→3. **Delete Confirmation Dialog** - Confirmation before deleting (Delete)
   444→4. **Data refresh** - After any mutation, refresh the data
   445→
   446→### Reusable CRUD Dialog Pattern
   447→
   448→Use a SINGLE dialog component for both Create and Edit per app:
   449→
   450→```typescript
   451→import { useState } from 'react';
   452→import { Dialog, DialogContent, DialogHeader, DialogTitle, DialogFooter } from '@/components/ui/dialog';
   453→import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button';
   454→import { Input } from '@/components/ui/input';
   455→import { Label } from '@/components/ui/label';
   456→import { LivingAppsService } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
   457→import { toast } from '@/components/ui/use-toast';
   458→
   459→interface RecordDialogProps {
   460→  open: boolean;
   461→  onOpenChange: (open: boolean) => void;
   462→  record?: MyAppRecord | null;  // null = Create mode, record = Edit mode
   463→  onSuccess: () => void;
   464→}
   465→
   466→function MyAppRecordDialog({ open, onOpenChange, record, onSuccess }: RecordDialogProps) {
   467→  const isEditing = !!record;
   468→  const [submitting, setSubmitting] = useState(false);
   469→  const [formData, setFormData] = useState({
   470→    name: record?.fields.name ?? '',
   471→    value: record?.fields.value ?? 0,
   472→    // ... all fields with defaults
   473→  });
   474→
   475→  // Reset form when dialog opens with different record
   476→  useEffect(() => {
   477→    if (open) {
   478→      setFormData({
   479→        name: record?.fields.name ?? '',
   480→        value: record?.fields.value ?? 0,
   481→      });
   482→    }
   483→  }, [open, record]);
   484→
   485→  async function handleSubmit(e: React.FormEvent) {
   486→    e.preventDefault();
   487→    setSubmitting(true);
   488→
   489→    try {
   490→      if (isEditing) {
   491→        await LivingAppsService.updateMyAppRecord(record!.record_id, formData);
   492→        toast({ title: 'Gespeichert', description: 'Eintrag wurde aktualisiert.' });
   493→      } else {
   494→        await LivingAppsService.createMyAppRecord(formData);
   495→        toast({ title: 'Erstellt', description: 'Neuer Eintrag wurde erstellt.' });
   496→      }
   497→      onOpenChange(false);
   498→      onSuccess();  // ← Triggers data refresh
   499→    } catch (err) {
   500→      toast({
   501→        title: 'Fehler',
   502→        description: `Fehler beim ${isEditing ? 'Speichern' : 'Erstellen'}: ${err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Unbekannter Fehler'}`,
   503→        variant: 'destructive',
   504→      });
   505→    } finally {
   506→      setSubmitting(false);
   507→    }
   508→  }
   509→
   510→  return (
   511→    <Dialog open={open} onOpenChange={onOpenChange}>
   512→      <DialogContent className="sm:max-w-md">
   513→        <DialogHeader>
   514→          <DialogTitle>{isEditing ? 'Eintrag bearbeiten' : 'Neuer Eintrag'}</DialogTitle>
   515→        </DialogHeader>
   516→        <form onSubmit={handleSubmit} className="space-y-4">
   517→          <div className="space-y-2">
   518→            <Label htmlFor="name">Name</Label>
   519→            <Input
   520→              id="name"
   521→              value={formData.name}
   522→              onChange={(e) => setFormData(prev => ({ ...prev, name: e.target.value }))}
   523→              required
   524→            />
   525→          </div>
   526→          {/* ... more fields ... */}
   527→          <DialogFooter>
   528→            <Button type="button" variant="outline" onClick={() => onOpenChange(false)}>
   529→              Abbrechen
   530→            </Button>
   531→            <Button type="submit" disabled={submitting}>
   532→              {submitting ? 'Speichert...' : (isEditing ? 'Speichern' : 'Erstellen')}
   533→            </Button>
   534→          </DialogFooter>
   535→        </form>
   536→      </DialogContent>
   537→    </Dialog>
   538→  );
   539→}
   540→```
   541→
   542→### Delete Confirmation Pattern
   543→
   544→**ALWAYS require confirmation before deleting!**
   545→
   546→```typescript
   547→import {
   548→  AlertDialog,
   549→  AlertDialogAction,
   550→  AlertDialogCancel,
   551→  AlertDialogContent,
   552→  AlertDialogDescription,
   553→  AlertDialogFooter,
   554→  AlertDialogHeader,
   555→  AlertDialogTitle,
   556→} from '@/components/ui/alert-dialog';
   557→
   558→interface DeleteDialogProps {
   559→  open: boolean;
   560→  onOpenChange: (open: boolean) => void;
   561→  recordName: string;  // What is being deleted (for display)
   562→  onConfirm: () => Promise<void>;
   563→}
   564→
   565→function DeleteConfirmDialog({ open, onOpenChange, recordName, onConfirm }: DeleteDialogProps) {
   566→  const [deleting, setDeleting] = useState(false);
   567→
   568→  async function handleDelete() {
   569→    setDeleting(true);
   570→    try {
   571→      await onConfirm();
   572→      toast({ title: 'Gelöscht', description: `"${recordName}" wurde gelöscht.` });
   573→      onOpenChange(false);
   574→    } catch (err) {
   575→      toast({
   576→        title: 'Fehler',
   577→        description: 'Eintrag konnte nicht gelöscht werden.',
   578→        variant: 'destructive',
   579→      });
   580→    } finally {
   581→      setDeleting(false);
   582→    }
   583→  }
   584→
   585→  return (
   586→    <AlertDialog open={open} onOpenChange={onOpenChange}>
   587→      <AlertDialogContent>
   588→        <AlertDialogHeader>
   589→          <AlertDialogTitle>Eintrag löschen?</AlertDialogTitle>
   590→          <AlertDialogDescription>
   591→            Möchtest du "{recordName}" wirklich löschen? Diese Aktion kann nicht rückgängig gemacht werden.
   592→          </AlertDialogDescription>
   593→        </AlertDialogHeader>
   594→        <AlertDialogFooter>
   595→          <AlertDialogCancel>Abbrechen</AlertDialogCancel>
   596→          <AlertDialogAction
   597→            onClick={handleDelete}
   598→            disabled={deleting}
   599→            className="bg-destructive text-destructive-foreground hover:bg-destructive/90"
   600→          >
   601→            {deleting ? 'Löscht...' : 'Löschen'}
   602→          </AlertDialogAction>
   603→        </AlertDialogFooter>
   604→      </AlertDialogContent>
   605→    </AlertDialog>
   606→  );
   607→}
   608→```
   609→
   610→### CRUD List with Edit/Delete Actions
   611→
   612→```typescript
   613→import { Pencil, Trash2, Plus } from 'lucide-react';
   614→
   615→function MyAppList() {
   616→  const [records, setRecords] = useState<MyAppRecord[]>([]);
   617→  const [editRecord, setEditRecord] = useState<MyAppRecord | null>(null);
   618→  const [deleteRecord, setDeleteRecord] = useState<MyAppRecord | null>(null);
   619→  const [showCreateDialog, setShowCreateDialog] = useState(false);
   620→
   621→  async function refreshData() {
   622→    const data = await LivingAppsService.getMyAppRecords();
   623→    setRecords(data);
   624→  }
   625→
   626→  async function handleDelete() {
   627→    if (!deleteRecord) return;
   628→    await LivingAppsService.deleteMyAppRecord(deleteRecord.record_id);
   629→    setDeleteRecord(null);
   630→    refreshData();
   631→  }
   632→
   633→  return (
   634→    <>
   635→      {/* Header with Create button */}
   636→      <div className="flex items-center justify-between mb-4">
   637→        <h2 className="text-lg font-semibold">Meine Einträge</h2>
   638→        <Button size="sm" onClick={() => setShowCreateDialog(true)}>
   639→          <Plus className="h-4 w-4 mr-1" /> Neu
   640→        </Button>
   641→      </div>
   642→
   643→      {/* Record list with inline edit/delete actions */}
   644→      {records.map((record) => (
   645→        <div key={record.record_id} className="flex items-center justify-between p-3 rounded-lg border">
   646→          <div>
   647→            <div className="font-medium">{record.fields.name}</div>
   648→            <div className="text-sm text-muted-foreground">{record.fields.description}</div>
   649→          </div>
   650→          <div className="flex gap-1">
   651→            <Button
   652→              variant="ghost"
   653→              size="icon"
   654→              onClick={() => setEditRecord(record)}
   655→              aria-label="Bearbeiten"
   656→            >
   657→              <Pencil className="h-4 w-4" />
   658→            </Button>
   659→            <Button
   660→              variant="ghost"
   661→              size="icon"
   662→              onClick={() => setDeleteRecord(record)}
   663→              aria-label="Löschen"
   664→              className="text-destructive hover:text-destructive"
   665→            >
   666→              <Trash2 className="h-4 w-4" />
   667→            </Button>
   668→          </div>
   669→        </div>
   670→      ))}
   671→
   672→      {/* Create Dialog (record=null → create mode) */}
   673→      <MyAppRecordDialog
   674→        open={showCreateDialog}
   675→        onOpenChange={setShowCreateDialog}
   676→        record={null}
   677→        onSuccess={refreshData}
   678→      />
   679→
   680→      {/* Edit Dialog (record=editRecord → edit mode) */}
   681→      <MyAppRecordDialog
   682→        open={!!editRecord}
   683→        onOpenChange={(open) => !open && setEditRecord(null)}
   684→        record={editRecord}
   685→        onSuccess={refreshData}
   686→      />
   687→
   688→      {/* Delete Confirmation */}
   689→      <DeleteConfirmDialog
   690→        open={!!deleteRecord}
   691→        onOpenChange={(open) => !open && setDeleteRecord(null)}
   692→        recordName={deleteRecord?.fields.name ?? ''}
   693→        onConfirm={handleDelete}
   694→      />
   695→    </>
   696→  );
   697→}
   698→```
   699→
   700→### CRUD Service Methods Pattern
   701→
   702→The generated `livingAppsService.ts` already includes GET and CREATE. You MUST also use UPDATE and DELETE:
   703→
   704→```typescript
   705→// These methods should already exist in livingAppsService.ts:
   706→
   707→// GET all records
   708→static async getMyAppRecords(): Promise<MyAppRecord[]> { ... }
   709→
   710→// CREATE a record
   711→static async createMyAppRecord(data: Partial<MyAppFields>): Promise<any> {
   712→  return this.request(`/apps/${APP_IDS.MY_APP}/records`, {
   713→    method: 'POST',
   714→    body: JSON.stringify(data),
   715→  });
   716→}
   717→
   718→// UPDATE a record (PATCH - only changed fields)
   719→static async updateMyAppRecord(recordId: string, data: Partial<MyAppFields>): Promise<any> {
   720→  return this.request(`/apps/${APP_IDS.MY_APP}/records/${recordId}`, {
   721→    method: 'PATCH',
   722→    body: JSON.stringify(data),
   723→  });
   724→}
   725→
   726→// DELETE a record
   727→static async deleteMyAppRecord(recordId: string): Promise<any> {
   728→  return this.request(`/apps/${APP_IDS.MY_APP}/records/${recordId}`, {
   729→    method: 'DELETE',
   730→  });
   731→}
   732→```
   733→
   734→**⚠️ If `livingAppsService.ts` is missing update/delete methods, you MUST add them!**
   735→
   736→### CRUD Implementation Checklist
   737→
   738→For EVERY app in `app_metadata.json`, verify:
   739→- [ ] **Create** - Users can create new records via dialog/form
   740→- [ ] **Read** - Records are displayed in a list/table with all relevant fields
   741→- [ ] **Update** - Users can edit existing records (same form as create, pre-filled)
   742→- [ ] **Delete** - Users can delete records with confirmation dialog
   743→- [ ] **Feedback** - Toast messages for success and error on every operation
   744→- [ ] **Refresh** - Data refreshes after every mutation
   745→- [ ] **Loading states** - Submit buttons show loading state during operations
   746→- [ ] **Error handling** - Failed operations show error message, don't lose user input
   747→
   748→---
   749→
   750→## React Router Navigation (REQUIRED!)
   751→
   752→**⚠️ CRITICAL: The dashboard MUST use React Router for navigation between apps.**
   753→
   754→Each app gets its own route/page. Do NOT build a single scrollable page with all apps crammed together.
   755→
   756→### Step 1: Install React Router (if not already)
   757→
   758→```bash
   759→npm install react-router-dom
   760→```
   761→
   762→### Step 2: Set Up Router in main.tsx
   763→
   764→```typescript
   765→import { BrowserRouter } from 'react-router-dom';
   766→
   767→ReactDOM.createRoot(document.getElementById('root')!).render(
   768→  <React.StrictMode>
   769→    <BrowserRouter basename={import.meta.env.BASE_URL}>
   770→      <App />
   771→    </BrowserRouter>
   772→  </React.StrictMode>
   773→);
   774→```
   775→
   776→**⚠️ CRITICAL: Always use `basename={import.meta.env.BASE_URL}`!** The dashboard is deployed to GitHub Pages under a subpath (e.g. `/repo-name/`). Without basename, all routes will break in production.
   777→
   778→### Step 3: Define Routes in App.tsx
   779→
   780→```typescript
   781→import { Routes, Route } from 'react-router-dom';
   782→import { Layout } from '@/components/Layout';
   783→import { DashboardOverview } from '@/pages/DashboardOverview';
   784→import { WorkoutsPage } from '@/pages/WorkoutsPage';
   785→import { ExercisesPage } from '@/pages/ExercisesPage';
   786→// ... import a page for each app
   787→
   788→function App() {
   789→  return (
   790→    <Layout>
   791→      <Routes>
   792→        <Route path="/" element={<DashboardOverview />} />
   793→        <Route path="/workouts" element={<WorkoutsPage />} />
   794→        <Route path="/exercises" element={<ExercisesPage />} />
   795→        {/* One route per app */}
   796→      </Routes>
   797→    </Layout>
   798→  );
   799→}
   800→```
   801→
   802→### Step 4: Create Layout with Navigation
   803→
   804→The Layout component wraps all pages and provides navigation.
   805→
   806→```typescript
   807→import { NavLink, useLocation } from 'react-router-dom';
   808→import { Home, Dumbbell, ListChecks } from 'lucide-react';
   809→import { cn } from '@/lib/utils';
   810→
   811→const NAV_ITEMS = [
   812→  { path: '/', label: 'Übersicht', icon: Home },
   813→  { path: '/workouts', label: 'Workouts', icon: Dumbbell },
   814→  { path: '/exercises', label: 'Übungen', icon: ListChecks },
   815→  // ... one per app
   816→];
   817→
   818→function Layout({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
   819→  return (
   820→    <div className="min-h-screen bg-background">
   821→      {/* Desktop: Sidebar navigation */}
   822→      <aside className="hidden md:flex md:w-64 md:flex-col md:fixed md:inset-y-0 border-r bg-card">
   823→        <div className="p-6">
   824→          <h1 className="text-xl font-bold">Dashboard</h1>
   825→        </div>
   826→        <nav className="flex-1 px-3 space-y-1">
   827→          {NAV_ITEMS.map((item) => (
   828→            <NavLink
   829→              key={item.path}
   830→              to={item.path}
   831→              className={({ isActive }) =>
   832→                cn(
   833→                  'flex items-center gap-3 px-3 py-2 rounded-lg text-sm font-medium transition-colors',
   834→                  isActive
   835→                    ? 'bg-primary text-primary-foreground'
   836→                    : 'text-muted-foreground hover:bg-muted hover:text-foreground'
   837→                )
   838→              }
   839→            >
   840→              <item.icon className="h-5 w-5" />
   841→              {item.label}
   842→            </NavLink>
   843→          ))}
   844→        </nav>
   845→      </aside>
   846→
   847→      {/* Main content area */}
   848→      <main className="md:pl-64">
   849→        <div className="p-4 md:p-8 max-w-7xl mx-auto">
   850→          {children}
   851→        </div>
   852→      </main>
   853→
   854→      {/* Mobile: Bottom tab navigation */}
   855→      <nav className="md:hidden fixed bottom-0 left-0 right-0 border-t bg-card z-50">
   856→        <div className="flex justify-around">
   857→          {NAV_ITEMS.map((item) => (
   858→            <NavLink
   859→              key={item.path}
   860→              to={item.path}
   861→              className={({ isActive }) =>
   862→                cn(
   863→                  'flex flex-col items-center gap-1 py-2 px-3 text-xs font-medium transition-colors',
   864→                  isActive ? 'text-primary' : 'text-muted-foreground'
   865→                )
   866→              }
   867→            >
   868→              <item.icon className="h-5 w-5" />
   869→              {item.label}
   870→            </NavLink>
   871→          ))}
   872→        </div>
   873→      </nav>
   874→    </div>
   875→  );
   876→}
   877→```
   878→
   879→### Step 5: Create a Page Per App
   880→
   881→Each app page contains the full CRUD view for that app:
   882→
   883→```typescript
   884→// src/pages/WorkoutsPage.tsx
   885→import { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
   886→import type { Workout } from '@/types/app';
   887→import { LivingAppsService } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
   888→
   889→export function WorkoutsPage() {
   890→  const [records, setRecords] = useState<Workout[]>([]);
   891→  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
   892→
   893→  async function refreshData() {
   894→    setLoading(true);
   895→    const data = await LivingAppsService.getWorkouts();
   896→    setRecords(data);
   897→    setLoading(false);
   898→  }
   899→
   900→  useEffect(() => { refreshData(); }, []);
   901→
   902→  // Full CRUD UI: list, create dialog, edit dialog, delete confirmation
   903→  return (
   904→    <div>
   905→      <div className="flex items-center justify-between mb-6">
   906→        <h1 className="text-2xl font-bold">Workouts</h1>
   907→        <Button onClick={() => setShowCreate(true)}>
   908→          <Plus className="h-4 w-4 mr-2" /> Neues Workout
   909→        </Button>
   910→      </div>
   911→      {/* Record list with edit/delete actions */}
   912→      {/* Create/Edit Dialog */}
   913→      {/* Delete Confirmation */}
   914→    </div>
   915→  );
   916→}
   917→```
   918→
   919→### Step 6: Dashboard Overview Page
   920→
   921→The root route (`/`) shows a summary across all apps:
   922→
   923→```typescript
   924→// src/pages/DashboardOverview.tsx
   925→export function DashboardOverview() {
   926→  // Fetch data from ALL apps for KPIs
   927→  // Show hero KPI, secondary KPIs, charts
   928→  // Quick action buttons that navigate to app pages
   929→  // Recent activity across all apps
   930→}
   931→```
   932→
   933→### File Structure
   934→
   935→Organize pages and components cleanly:
   936→
   937→```
   938→src/
   939→├── main.tsx                    # BrowserRouter setup
   940→├── App.tsx                     # Routes definition
   941→├── components/
   942→│   ├── Layout.tsx              # Navigation layout (sidebar + bottom tabs)
   943→│   ├── ui/                     # shadcn components
   944→│   └── shared/                 # Shared components (DeleteDialog, etc.)
   945→├── pages/
   946→│   ├── DashboardOverview.tsx   # / route - summary across all apps
   947→│   ├── WorkoutsPage.tsx        # /workouts - full CRUD for Workouts app
   948→│   ├── ExercisesPage.tsx       # /exercises - full CRUD for Exercises app
   949→│   └── ...                     # One page per app
   950→├── services/
   951→│   └── livingAppsService.ts    # API service (generated)
   952→└── types/
   953→    └── app.ts                  # TypeScript types (generated)
   954→```
   955→
   956→### Navigation Rules
   957→
   958→1. **Use `NavLink`, not `Link`** - NavLink provides `isActive` for styling
   959→2. **Always use `basename`** - Required for GitHub Pages deployment
   960→3. **Mobile: max 5 bottom tabs** - If more apps, use a "More" tab or hamburger menu
   961→4. **Desktop: sidebar always visible** - Shows all apps with icons and labels
   962→5. **Active route highlighted** - Follow design_brief.md for exact styling
   963→6. **Page title** - Each page should have a clear `<h1>` title
   964→
   965→### React Router Checklist
   966→
   967→- [ ] `react-router-dom` installed
   968→- [ ] `BrowserRouter` with `basename` in main.tsx
   969→- [ ] Routes defined for every app in App.tsx
   970→- [ ] Layout component with sidebar (desktop) + bottom tabs (mobile)
   971→- [ ] `NavLink` used with active state styling
   972→- [ ] Dashboard Overview page at `/` with summary KPIs
   973→- [ ] One page per app with full CRUD
   974→- [ ] Mobile bottom tabs don't overlap content (add `pb-16` to main content)
   975→- [ ] Navigation matches design_brief.md Section 7
   976→
   977→---
   978→
   979→## Drill-Down: When and How to Use It
   980→
   981→Drill-down is useful when there's **more information to show** than fits in the summary view. Don't add it everywhere - only where it adds value.
   982→
   983→### When to Use Drill-Down
   984→
   985→| Good Use Cases | Skip Drill-Down When... |
   986→|----------------|------------------------|
   987→| List item → show full record details | The summary already shows everything |
   988→| Summary count → show the items being counted | It's a simple, self-explanatory number |
   989→| Record reference → view the related record | There's no additional detail to show |
   990→
   991→### Make It Obvious
   992→
   993→If something is clickable, make it visually clear:
   994→- Hover effect (shadow, background change)
   995→- Cursor pointer
   996→- Underline or chevron icon for "see more"
   997→
   998→### Implementation Pattern: Clickable List Item
   999→
  1000→```typescript
  1001→// Use when list items have more details to show
  1002→<div
  1003→  className="p-3 rounded-lg hover:bg-muted cursor-pointer transition-colors"
  1004→  onClick={() => setSelectedRecord(record)}
  1005→>
  1006→  <div className="font-medium">{record.name}</div>
  1007→  <div className="text-sm text-muted-foreground">{record.summary}</div>
  1008→</div>
  1009→```
  1010→
  1011→**Don't force drill-down everywhere.** A simple KPI that shows "5 workouts this week" doesn't need a click handler if there's nothing more to show.
  1012→
  1013→---
  1014→
  1015→## UX Details - Don't Forget!
  1016→
  1017→### Loading States
  1018→```typescript
  1019→if (loading) {
  1020→  return <LoadingState />;  // Use Skeleton, not spinner
  1021→}
  1022→```
  1023→
  1024→### Empty States
  1025→```typescript
  1026→if (data.length === 0) {
  1027→  return (
  1028→    <EmptyState 
  1029→      title="No data yet"
  1030→      description="Get started by adding your first item"
  1031→      action={<Button>Add First Item</Button>}
  1032→    />
  1033→  );
  1034→}
  1035→```
  1036→
  1037→### Error States
  1038→```typescript
  1039→if (error) {
  1040→  return (
  1041→    <Alert variant="destructive">
  1042→      <AlertCircle className="h-4 w-4" />
  1043→      <AlertTitle>Error</AlertTitle>
  1044→      <AlertDescription>
  1045→        {error.message}
  1046→        <Button variant="outline" onClick={retry}>Try Again</Button>
  1047→      </AlertDescription>
  1048→    </Alert>
  1049→  );
  1050→}
  1051→```
  1052→
  1053→### Success Feedback
  1054→```typescript
  1055→// Use toast for success messages
  1056→import { toast } from '@/components/ui/use-toast';
  1057→
  1058→toast({
  1059→  title: "Success!",
  1060→  description: "Item saved successfully.",
  1061→});
  1062→```
  1063→
  1064→### Hover States
  1065→```typescript
  1066→// Cards should have hover feedback
  1067→<Card className="hover:shadow-md transition-shadow cursor-pointer">
  1068→```
  1069→
  1070→---
  1071→
  1072→# Living Apps API Reference
  1073→
  1074→## ⚠️ Critical API Rules
  1075→
  1076→These rules are **non-negotiable**. Breaking them causes runtime errors.
  1077→
  1078→---
  1079→
  1080→## 1. Date Formats
  1081→
  1082→Living Apps has strict date format requirements:
  1083→
  1084→| Field Type | Format | Example |
  1085→|------------|--------|---------|
  1086→| `date/datetimeminute` | `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM` | `2025-11-06T12:00` |
  1087→| `date/date` | `YYYY-MM-DD` | `2025-11-06` |
  1088→
  1089→### ❌ WRONG
  1090→```typescript
  1091→// Seconds are NOT allowed for datetimeminute!
  1092→const date = '2025-11-06T12:00:00';  // ❌ Will fail
  1093→```
  1094→
  1095→### ✅ CORRECT
  1096→```typescript
  1097→// For date/datetimeminute fields
  1098→const dateForAPI = formData.datum + 'T12:00';  // ✅ YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM
  1099→
  1100→// For date/date fields
  1101→const dateForAPI = formData.datum;  // ✅ YYYY-MM-DD
  1102→
  1103→// Display in <input type="date">
  1104→const dateForInput = apiData.datum?.split('T')[0];  // Extract YYYY-MM-DD
  1105→```
  1106→
  1107→---
  1108→
  1109→## 2. applookup Fields
  1110→
  1111→`applookup/select` fields store **full URLs** to related records.
  1112→
  1113→### URL Format
  1114→```
  1115→https://my.living-apps.de/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}
  1116→```
  1117→
  1118→### ⚠️ CRITICAL: Always use extractRecordId()
  1119→
  1120→```typescript
  1121→// ❌ NEVER do this manually
  1122→const parts = url.split('/');
  1123→const id = parts[parts.length - 1];  // ❌ Fragile!
  1124→
  1125→// ✅ ALWAYS use the helper function
  1126→import { extractRecordId } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
  1127→
  1128→const recordId = extractRecordId(url);
  1129→if (!recordId) return;  // ✅ Always null-check!
  1130→```
  1131→
  1132→### extractRecordId() Implementation
  1133→```typescript
  1134→export function extractRecordId(url: string | null | undefined): string | null {
  1135→  if (!url) return null;
  1136→  // Extracts last 24 hex characters (Living Apps Record IDs)
  1137→  const match = url.match(/([a-f0-9]{24})$/i);
  1138→  return match ? match[1] : null;
  1139→}
  1140→```
  1141→
  1142→### Creating applookup Values
  1143→```typescript
  1144→import { createRecordUrl, APP_IDS } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
  1145→
  1146→// When creating/updating records with applookup fields
  1147→const data = {
  1148→  kategorie: createRecordUrl(APP_IDS.KATEGORIEN, selectedKategorieId),
  1149→};
  1150→
  1151→// createRecordUrl returns:
  1152→// 'https://my.living-apps.de/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}'
  1153→```
  1154→
  1155→### applookup Can Be Null!
  1156→```typescript
  1157→// ❌ WRONG - Will crash if field is null
  1158→workoutLogs.forEach((log) => {
  1159→  const id = extractRecordId(log.fields.uebung);
  1160→  data[id] = log;  // ❌ Crashes if id is null
  1161→});
  1162→
  1163→// ✅ CORRECT - Defensive programming
  1164→workoutLogs.forEach((log) => {
  1165→  const id = extractRecordId(log.fields.uebung);
  1166→  if (!id) return;  // ✅ Skip if null
  1167→  if (!data[id]) data[id] = [];
  1168→  data[id].push(log);
  1169→});
  1170→```
  1171→
  1172→---
  1173→
  1174→## 3. API Response Format
  1175→
  1176→Living Apps returns **objects**, not arrays!
  1177→
  1178→### Response Structure
  1179→```typescript
  1180→// API returns:
  1181→{
  1182→  "690abc123...": {
  1183→    "createdat": "2025-11-06T10:00:00",
  1184→    "updatedat": null,
  1185→    "fields": {
  1186→      "name": "Item 1",
  1187→      "value": 100
  1188→    }
  1189→  },
  1190→  "690def456...": {
  1191→    "createdat": "2025-11-06T11:00:00",
  1192→    "updatedat": null,
  1193→    "fields": {
  1194→      "name": "Item 2",
  1195→      "value": 200
  1196→    }
  1197→  }
  1198→}
  1199→```
  1200→
  1201→### ❌ WRONG Transformation
  1202→```typescript
  1203→// Loses record_id!
  1204→const items = Object.values(response);  // ❌ No record_id!
  1205→```
  1206→
  1207→### ✅ CORRECT Transformation
  1208→```typescript
  1209→// Use Object.entries() to preserve record_id
  1210→const items = Object.entries(response).map(([record_id, record]) => ({
  1211→  record_id,  // ← From the key
  1212→  createdat: record.createdat,
  1213→  updatedat: record.updatedat,
  1214→  ...record.fields,
  1215→}));
  1216→```
  1217→
  1218→### Why record_id Matters
  1219→- Required for React `key` prop
  1220→- Required for update/delete operations
  1221→- Required for applookup references
  1222→
  1223→---
  1224→
  1225→## 4. API Authentication
  1226→
  1227→```typescript
  1228→const headers = {
  1229→  'X-API-Key': API_KEY,  // From environment
  1230→  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  1231→  'Accept': 'application/json',
  1232→};
  1233→```
  1234→
  1235→### Proxy vs Direct URL
  1236→```typescript
  1237→// For API calls (via proxy)
  1238→const API_BASE = '/api/rest';
  1239→
  1240→// For applookup values (direct)
  1241→const APPLOOKUP_BASE = 'https://my.living-apps.de/rest';
  1242→```
  1243→
  1244→---
  1245→
  1246→## 5. CRUD Operations
  1247→
  1248→### GET All Records
  1249→```typescript
  1250→GET /api/rest/apps/{app_id}/records
  1251→```
  1252→
  1253→### GET Single Record
  1254→```typescript
  1255→GET /api/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}
  1256→```
  1257→
  1258→### CREATE Record
  1259→```typescript
  1260→POST /api/rest/apps/{app_id}/records
  1261→Content-Type: application/json
  1262→
  1263→{
  1264→  "name": "New Item",
  1265→  "value": 100
  1266→}
  1267→```
  1268→
  1269→### UPDATE Record
  1270→```typescript
  1271→PATCH /api/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}
  1272→Content-Type: application/json
  1273→
  1274→{
  1275→  "value": 150  // Only changed fields
  1276→}
  1277→```
  1278→
  1279→### DELETE Record
  1280→```typescript
  1281→DELETE /api/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}
  1282→
  1283→// Note: DELETE also returns JSON, always call response.json()
  1284→```
  1285→
  1286→---
  1287→
  1288→## 6. Error Handling
  1289→
  1290→```typescript
  1291→async function callAPI(method: string, endpoint: string, data?: any) {
  1292→  const response = await fetch(`${API_BASE}${endpoint}`, {
  1293→    method,
  1294→    headers: {
  1295→      'X-API-Key': API_KEY,
  1296→      'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  1297→    },
  1298→    body: data ? JSON.stringify(data) : undefined,
  1299→  });
  1300→
  1301→  if (!response.ok) {
  1302→    const errorText = await response.text();
  1303→    throw new Error(`API Error (${response.status}): ${errorText}`);
  1304→  }
  1305→
  1306→  return response.json();  // Always parse JSON, even for DELETE
  1307→}
  1308→```
  1309→
  1310→---
  1311→
  1312→## 7. Metadata Structure
  1313→
  1314→`app_metadata.json` contains the **complete, real metadata from Living Apps REST API**.
  1315→
  1316→**IMPORTANT:**
  1317→- `controls` is an **OBJECT** (not array!)
  1318→- Each control has `identifier`, `label`, `type`, `subtype`, `fulltype`
  1319→- `lookup/select` has `lookup_data` with all options
  1320→- `applookup/select` has `lookup_app` URL to the linked app
  1321→
  1322→```typescript
  1323→{
  1324→  "appgroup_id": "...",
  1325→  "appgroup_name": "My App Group",
  1326→  "apps": {
  1327→    "app_identifier": {
  1328→      "app_id": "...",
  1329→      "name": "App Display Name",
  1330→      "controls": {
  1331→        "control_identifier": {
  1332→          "identifier": "field_name",      // Use this as field key
  1333→          "label": "Field Label",          // Use this for UI display
  1334→          "type": "string",                // Base type
  1335→          "subtype": null,                 // or "select", "textarea", etc.
  1336→          "fulltype": "string/text",       // Combined: type/subtype
  1337→          "lookup_data": [                 // For lookup/select fields
  1338→            { "key": "option1", "value": "Option 1" },
  1339→            { "key": "option2", "value": "Option 2" }
  1340→          ],
  1341→          "lookup_app": "https://my.living-apps.de/rest/apps/{app_id}"  // For applookup
  1342→        }
  1343→      }
  1344→    }
  1345→  }
  1346→}
  1347→```
  1348→
  1349→### Common Field Types
  1350→| fulltype | TypeScript | Notes |
  1351→|----------|------------|-------|
  1352→| `string/text` | `string` | Plain text |
  1353→| `string/textarea` | `string` | Multiline text |
  1354→| `number/number` | `number` | Numeric |
  1355→| `bool/bool` | `boolean` | True/false |
  1356→| `date/date` | `string` | YYYY-MM-DD |
  1357→| `date/datetimeminute` | `string` | YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM (NO seconds!) |
  1358→| `lookup/select` | `string` | From predefined list (lookup_data) |
  1359→| `applookup/select` | `string \| null` | URL to another app's record |
  1360→
  1361→### Using Metadata for UI
  1362→```typescript
  1363→// Use field labels for UI
  1364→const fieldLabel = metadata.apps.myapp.controls.myfield.label;
  1365→
  1366→// Use lookup_data for Select options
  1367→const options = metadata.apps.myapp.controls.status.lookup_data;
  1368→// → [{ key: "active", value: "Active" }, { key: "done", value: "Done" }]
  1369→```
  1370→

  1459→// → "6. November 2025"
  1460→

  1462→formatDistance(parseISO(record.createdat), new Date(), { 
  1463→  addSuffix: true, 
  1464→  locale: de 
  1465→});

  1467→
  1468→// For input type="date"

  1474→
  1475→## TypeScript Patterns
  1476→
  1477→### ⚠️ CRITICAL: Type-Only Imports
  1478→
  1479→TypeScript's `verbatimModuleSyntax` requires explicit type imports:
  1480→
  1481→```typescript
  1482→// ❌ WRONG - TypeScript error
  1483→import { Workout, Ernaehrung } from '@/types/app';
  1484→
  1485→// ✅ CORRECT - Option 1 (preferred)
  1486→import type { Workout, Ernaehrung } from '@/types/app';
  1487→
  1488→// ✅ CORRECT - Option 2
  1489→import { type Workout, type Ernaehrung } from '@/types/app';
  1490→```
  1491→
  1492→---
  1493→
  1494→## Data Fetching Pattern
  1495→
  1496→```typescript
  1497→import { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
  1498→import type { Workout } from '@/types/app';
  1499→import { LivingAppsService } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
  1500→
  1501→function Dashboard() {
  1502→  const [data, setData] = useState<Workout[]>([]);
  1503→  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  1504→  const [error, setError] = useState<Error | null>(null);
  1505→
  1506→  useEffect(() => {
  1507→    async function fetchData() {
  1508→      try {
  1509→        setLoading(true);
  1510→        const result = await LivingAppsService.getWorkouts();
  1511→        setData(result);
  1512→      } catch (err) {
  1513→        setError(err instanceof Error ? err : new Error('Unknown error'));
  1514→      } finally {
  1515→        setLoading(false);
  1516→      }
  1517→    }
  1518→    fetchData();
  1519→  }, []);
  1520→
  1521→  if (loading) return <LoadingState />;
  1522→  if (error) return <ErrorState error={error} onRetry={() => window.location.reload()} />;
  1523→  if (data.length === 0) return <EmptyState />;
  1524→
  1525→  return <DashboardContent data={data} />;
  1526→}
  1527→```
  1528→
  1529→---
  1530→
  1531→## Relationship Handling (applookup)
  1532→
  1533→### Joining Data from Multiple Apps
  1534→
  1535→```typescript
  1536→import type { Workout, Exercise } from '@/types/app';
  1537→import { extractRecordId } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
  1538→
  1539→function useDashboardData() {
  1540→  const [workouts, setWorkouts] = useState<Workout[]>([]);
  1541→  const [exercises, setExercises] = useState<Exercise[]>([]);
  1542→
  1543→  useEffect(() => {
  1544→    async function load() {
  1545→      const [w, e] = await Promise.all([
  1546→        LivingAppsService.getWorkouts(),
  1547→        LivingAppsService.getExercises(),
  1548→      ]);
  1549→      setWorkouts(w);
  1550→      setExercises(e);
  1551→    }
  1552→    load();
  1553→  }, []);
  1554→
  1555→  // Create lookup map for exercises
  1556→  const exerciseMap = useMemo(() => {
  1557→    const map = new Map<string, Exercise>();
  1558→    exercises.forEach(ex => map.set(ex.record_id, ex));
  1559→    return map;
  1560→  }, [exercises]);
  1561→
  1562→  // Enrich workouts with exercise data
  1563→  const enrichedWorkouts = useMemo(() => {
  1564→    return workouts.map(workout => {
  1565→      const exerciseId = extractRecordId(workout.fields.exercise);
  1566→      const exercise = exerciseId ? exerciseMap.get(exerciseId) : null;
  1567→      return { ...workout, exercise };
  1568→    });
  1569→  }, [workouts, exerciseMap]);
  1570→
  1571→  return { enrichedWorkouts, loading, error };
  1572→}
  1573→```
  1574→
  1575→### Grouping by Relationship
  1576→
  1577→```typescript
  1578→// Group items by a related record
  1579→function groupByRelation<T extends { fields: { [key: string]: any } }>(
  1580→  items: T[],
  1581→  relationField: string
  1582→): Map<string, T[]> {
  1583→  const groups = new Map<string, T[]>();
  1584→  
  1585→  items.forEach(item => {
  1586→    const relatedId = extractRecordId(item.fields[relationField]);
  1587→    if (!relatedId) return;  // ✅ Skip items without relation
  1588→    
  1589→    if (!groups.has(relatedId)) {
  1590→      groups.set(relatedId, []);
  1591→    }
  1592→    groups.get(relatedId)!.push(item);
  1593→  });
  1594→  
  1595→  return groups;
  1596→}
  1597→
  1598→// Usage
  1599→const workoutsByExercise = groupByRelation(workouts, 'exercise');
  1600→```
  1601→
  1602→---
  1603→
  1604→## Form Handling Pattern
  1605→
  1606→```typescript
  1607→import { useState } from 'react';
  1608→import type { WorkoutInput } from '@/types/app';
  1609→import { LivingAppsService, createRecordUrl, APP_IDS } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
  1610→
  1611→function AddWorkoutForm({ onSuccess }: { onSuccess: () => void }) {
  1612→  const [formData, setFormData] = useState<Partial<WorkoutInput>>({});
  1613→  const [submitting, setSubmitting] = useState(false);
  1614→
  1615→  async function handleSubmit(e: React.FormEvent) {
  1616→    e.preventDefault();
  1617→    setSubmitting(true);
  1618→
  1619→    try {
  1620→      // Transform data for API
  1621→      const apiData = {
  1622→        ...formData,
  1623→        // Date format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM (no seconds!)
  1624→        datum: formData.datum + 'T12:00',
  1625→        // applookup: full URL
  1626→        exercise: formData.exerciseId 
  1627→          ? createRecordUrl(APP_IDS.EXERCISES, formData.exerciseId)
  1628→          : null,
  1629→      };
  1630→
  1631→      await LivingAppsService.createWorkout(apiData);
  1632→      onSuccess();
  1633→    } catch (err) {
  1634→      console.error('Failed to create:', err);
  1635→    } finally {
  1636→      setSubmitting(false);
  1637→    }
  1638→  }
  1639→
  1640→  return (
  1641→    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit}>
  1642→      {/* Form fields */}
  1643→    </form>
  1644→  );
  1645→}
  1646→```

  1673→
  1674→### ⚠️ Select Component - No Empty Strings!
  1675→
  1676→```typescript
  1677→// ❌ WRONG - Runtime error!
  1678→<SelectItem value="">No selection</SelectItem>
  1679→
  1680→// ✅ CORRECT - Use placeholder
  1681→<Select value={value} onValueChange={setValue}>
  1682→  <SelectTrigger>
  1683→    <SelectValue placeholder="Select option..." />
  1684→  </SelectTrigger>
  1685→  <SelectContent>
  1686→    <SelectItem value="option1">Option 1</SelectItem>
  1687→    <SelectItem value="option2">Option 2</SelectItem>
  1688→  </SelectContent>
  1689→</Select>
  1690→
  1691→// ✅ CORRECT - Use special value for "none"
  1692→<Select value={value || "none"} onValueChange={v => setValue(v === "none" ? "" : v)}>
  1693→  <SelectTrigger>
  1694→    <SelectValue />
  1695→  </SelectTrigger>
  1696→  <SelectContent>
  1697→    <SelectItem value="none">No selection</SelectItem>
  1698→    <SelectItem value="option1">Option 1</SelectItem>
  1699→  </SelectContent>
  1700→</Select>
  1701→```

  1735→## Chart Patterns (recharts)
  1736→
  1737→### Basic Line Chart
  1738→
  1739→```typescript
  1740→import { LineChart, Line, XAxis, YAxis, Tooltip, ResponsiveContainer } from 'recharts';
  1741→
  1742→function TrendChart({ data }: { data: Array<{ name: string; value: number }> }) {
  1743→  return (
  1744→    <div className="h-[300px]">
  1745→      <ResponsiveContainer width="100%" height="100%">
  1746→        <LineChart data={data}>
  1747→          <XAxis 
  1748→            dataKey="name" 
  1749→            tick={{ fontSize: 12 }}
  1750→            stroke="hsl(var(--muted-foreground))"
  1751→          />
  1752→          <YAxis 
  1753→            tick={{ fontSize: 12 }}
  1754→            stroke="hsl(var(--muted-foreground))"
  1755→          />
  1756→          <Tooltip 
  1757→            contentStyle={{ 
  1758→              backgroundColor: 'hsl(var(--background))',
  1759→              border: '1px solid hsl(var(--border))',
  1760→            }}
  1761→          />
  1762→          <Line 
  1763→            type="monotone" 
  1764→            dataKey="value" 
  1765→            stroke="hsl(var(--primary))"
  1766→            strokeWidth={2}
  1767→            dot={false}
  1768→          />
  1769→        </LineChart>
  1770→      </ResponsiveContainer>
  1771→    </div>
  1772→  );
  1773→}
  1774→```
  1775→
  1776→### Data Aggregation for Charts
  1777→
  1778→```typescript
  1779→// Group by date
  1780→function aggregateByDate<T extends { createdat: string }>(
  1781→  items: T[],
  1782→  valueExtractor: (item: T) => number
  1783→): Array<{ date: string; value: number }> {
  1784→  const groups = new Map<string, number>();
  1785→  
  1786→  items.forEach(item => {
  1787→    const date = item.createdat.split('T')[0];  // YYYY-MM-DD
  1788→    const current = groups.get(date) || 0;
  1789→    groups.set(date, current + valueExtractor(item));
  1790→  });
  1791→  
  1792→  return Array.from(groups.entries())
  1793→    .map(([date, value]) => ({ date, value }))
  1794→    .sort((a, b) => a.date.localeCompare(b.date));
  1795→}
  1796→```

  1803→import { format, parseISO, formatDistance } from 'date-fns';
  1804→import { de } from 'date-fns/locale';
  1805→
  1806→// Format for display
  1807→const formatted = format(parseISO(record.createdat), 'dd.MM.yyyy', { locale: de });
  1808→// → "06.11.2025"
  1809→
  1810→// Relative time
  1811→const relative = formatDistance(parseISO(record.createdat), new Date(), { 
  1812→  addSuffix: true,
  1813→  locale: de 
  1814→});
  1815→// → "vor 3 Tagen"
  1816→
  1817→// For input type="date"
  1818→const inputValue = record.datum?.split('T')[0] || '';
  1819→// → "2025-11-06"
  1820→```

  1823→
  1824→## Utility Functions
  1825→
  1826→### Safe Number Formatting
  1827→
  1828→```typescript
  1829→function formatNumber(value: number | null | undefined): string {
  1830→  if (value == null) return '-';
  1831→  return new Intl.NumberFormat('de-DE').format(value);
  1832→}
  1833→
  1834→function formatCurrency(value: number | null | undefined): string {
  1835→  if (value == null) return '-';
  1836→  return new Intl.NumberFormat('de-DE', {
  1837→    style: 'currency',
  1838→    currency: 'EUR',
  1839→  }).format(value);
  1840→}
  1841→
  1842→function formatPercent(value: number | null | undefined): string {
  1843→  if (value == null) return '-';
  1844→  return new Intl.NumberFormat('de-DE', {
  1845→    style: 'percent',
  1846→    minimumFractionDigits: 1,
  1847→  }).format(value / 100);
  1848→}
  1849→```
  1850→
  1851→### Calculate KPIs
  1852→
  1853→```typescript
  1854→function calculateStats<T>(
  1855→  items: T[],
  1856→  valueExtractor: (item: T) => number | null | undefined
  1857→) {
  1858→  const values = items
  1859→    .map(valueExtractor)
  1860→    .filter((v): v is number => v != null);
  1861→  
  1862→  if (values.length === 0) {
  1863→    return { sum: 0, avg: 0, min: 0, max: 0, count: 0 };
  1864→  }
  1865→  
  1866→  return {
  1867→    sum: values.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0),
  1868→    avg: values.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / values.length,
  1869→    min: Math.min(...values),
  1870→    max: Math.max(...values),
  1871→    count: values.length,
  1872→  };
  1873→}
  1874→```
  1875→

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

     2→name: frontend-design
